page.title: 09FARMING.
page.content: In our 12sq. km.{survey,}we wrote to all{12 farms}from which we had 11 replies. The size of the farms varied between 484.5 acres and 0.{The average {size was 178.2 acres.}The ages of the farms varied between 70 and 355 years; the average age being 182 years. {The farming is mainly dairy and {beef.} Produce is mainly marketed at Stokesley, Thirsk, Ruswarp, and Darlington. One farm has its own shop. The commonest cereal is Barley used mainly for winter-feed. Fresian and Limousin are the main breeds of dairy cattle. {The traditional farm-buildings {are of sandstone with red pantile {roofing.} The buildings are usually connected, with the farmhouse at one end and the byres and storage areas leading from the living-quarters.
